intro: Plagiopteron, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its unique, zigzagging stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically small and clustered in whorls, often with two lips that are brightly colored. Plagiopteron species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
